suck.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in
suck.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Michael put the cigarette to his lips and sucked in the smoke.
a baby sucking at its mother’s breast
Jennie sucked up the last bit of milk shake with her straw.
suck.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to hold something in your mouth and pull on it with your tongue and lips
suck.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: a picture of Lara sucking on a lollipop
suck.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to pull someone or something with great power and force into or out of a particular place
suck.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: A bird was sucked into one of the jet’s engines.
The fluid was sucked from his lungs.
